intro: Bidens nyikensis, commonly known as the Nyikénsis ironweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant features slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with rough textures. Its flowers are typically yellow with prominent central disc florets, and it produces small, three-lobed seeds. Bidens nyikensis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in partial to full sunlight.
